¶ for ase muche ase a lewed Man &punctelev; þe o partye, was

And fram þe kinge non herre'— &punctelev; so þat atþenende
Þe playdingue fram holi churche &punctelev; to þe kingue scholde iwende
And þe king amendi scholde &punctelev; þe Erchebischopes dede
And beon chief of holi churche— &punctelev; ake seint thomas it withseide

[xa.]¶ Þe teoþe was, '&yogh;if ani clerk &punctelev; ase felun were itake

Þeos customes, and manie oþere &punctelev; þe king pulte forth anon

Þene feorþe dai bifore candelemasse &punctelev; þo þis was ido
Þe king het seint thomas anon &punctelev; and þe oþere bischopus also
On þis chartre heore seles sette &punctelev; þat non afturtale nere
Þat þulke costomes weren iholde &punctelev; þoru&yogh; al þe londe þere
"Sire, sire," quath seint thomas &punctelev; "for godes loue þin ore

So þat respit was þarof Inome &punctelev; and ech wende In his side
¶ Seint thomas nam þat transcrit &punctelev; and nolde no lengore abide

hov he mi&yogh;te holi churche schilde &punctelev; fram þis muchele wov&yogh;
&yogh;wane oþur Men weren faste aslepe &punctelev; he wep and si&yogh;te sore

Oþur holi churche was al bineþe &punctelev; þat with ri&yogh;te was so freo
Sori and careful he was Inov &punctelev; þat he tok on so
Forto entri into Answere &punctelev; þare he ne ou&yogh;te nou&yogh;t to do
Þat he afeng þat transcrit &punctelev; and respit hadde ibede
For him þou&yogh;te þat alholi churche &punctelev; In þat he misdude
For holi churche ne scholde &punctelev; In none stude stonde to dome
Ne Ansuerie kinge ne prince noþur &punctelev; bote þe pope of rome
¶ Þe deol þat thomas makede &punctelev; no tounge telle ne may
"Louerd," he seide, "alas, alas &punctelev; þat ich euere isai&yogh; þis day

Þat ich hire scholde bineoþe bringe &punctelev; Allas! and so bitraie

luytel wuyrth ich am of holi churche &punctelev; wardein forto beo

For ich nam nou&yogh;t, ase ri&yogh;t was &punctelev; fram none ordre inome

Of houndes ich was wardeyn &punctelev; and of hauekes with þe king

Þe deol þat þis holi man makede &punctelev; withouten ende it was

And wende toward Caunterburi. &punctelev; sone þe kinge men tolde
Þat þe Erchebischop nolde nou&yogh;t &punctelev; þe newe statuz holde
Þe king het his baillifs sone &punctelev; and sende aboute is sonde
Þat heo scholden greui seint thomas &punctelev; oueral on is londes

forto don euerech is beste &punctelev; ech wende In is side

Seint thomas tolde hem þo &punctelev; wel Mildeliche atþe laste

Withoute leue of þe kinge &punctelev; oute of londe wende
Ake þe king sende is men sone &punctelev; to saisi al is lond
And also al is bischopriche &punctelev; ase is traitores, Into is hond
Þis baillifs comen to caunterburi &punctelev; ase heo ihote were

Noþing ne mi&yogh;ten heo saisi þo &punctelev; heore wei heo hadden forlore

At is manere at wodestoke &punctelev; to þe kinge he cam

¶ Þe Erchebischop of Euerwyke &punctelev; fondede forto bringe

bote þat þe status of clarindone &punctelev; ech bischop holde scholde

Oþur he moste stif withstonde &punctelev; oþur is ri&yogh;tes forgon

¶ "Certes, bev frere," quath seint thomas &punctelev; "Ine þenche noþing þerto

And for him and for his honour &punctelev; ich bidde ni&yogh;t and dai
For þare nis nouþe man on eorþe &punctelev; þat ich louie, iwis
So muche ase him, sauue is fader &punctelev; þat &yogh;eot mi louerd is
Aseinte Marie dai Maugdeleyne &punctelev; forsoþe i segge þe
Þo þe acord was formest imaked &punctelev; bitwene mi louerd and me
he seide me þat ich lete amansi &punctelev; alle þat hadden misdo
Mine churche þat is his owene Moder— &punctelev; and ich habbe idon so."
¶ "Avoy, sire preost," quath þis oþur &punctelev; "to muche þov spext nei&yogh;
Þov desclaundrest þin owene louerd &punctelev; þov ne art noþer guod ne slei&yogh;
[Miles.]Seistþov þat mi louerd þe king &punctelev; In mansinge let do
Alle þat maden is sone king? &punctelev; ne consentede he þerto
Nas it al is owene dede &punctelev; and bi none oþur mannes lore
Avoy, sire preost, biþench þe bet &punctelev; ne seie þov so namore."
¶ "Certes, sire," quath seint thomas &punctelev; "þou wost wel it was so,[thomas.]
For þou were þare þiself þo &punctelev; and manie oþere þerto
bischopus and Erchebischopus ek &punctelev; and oþere grete and hei&yogh;e
&YOGH;e fif hundred men and mo &punctelev; also þov wel isei&yogh;e."
[Miles.]¶ "beo stille," quath þis luþere kni&yogh;t &punctelev; "hold þinne mouthþ, ich rede
Þov misseist mi louerd þe king &punctelev; daþeit alle þat it seide
ho mi&yogh;te soffri swuch sclaundre &punctelev; bote he nome þarof wreche
bi þe fei þat schal to god &punctelev; man schal þe anoþur teche!"
his felawes euerechone &punctelev; heore Armes abrod caste
And ferden ase Men þat weren wode &punctelev; and þretneden him wel faste
to þe Monekus heo wenden anon &punctelev; "comieth here forth," he seide
"&YOGH;e holdeth here þe kingus fo &punctelev; witiez him wel, ich rede
Þat &yogh;e to þe kingus wille &punctelev; is bodi &yogh;e[om. &yogh;e] habben al&yogh;are
Oþur he schal ouwer londes aboute &punctelev; and ower maneres maken wel bare!"
[thomas.]¶ "Sire Reynaud," quath seint thomas &punctelev; "wenstþou þat ichulle fleo
Nai par deu, nou&yogh;t a fote &punctelev; for þe king ne for þe."
[Miles.]¶ "bi god, sire bischop," quath þis oþur &punctelev; "bi þat þou wost þen ende
Þi fleoinge schal beo luyte wurth &punctelev; þou ne schalt nou&yogh;t wel fer wende."
Þis kni&yogh;tes in grete wrathþe þo &punctelev; wenden heom forth echon
And leten heom army swyþe wel &punctelev; and comen a&yogh;en anon
W[i]th suerdes and with axes &punctelev; and with oþere armes mo
Robert de brok, þe luþere clerk &punctelev; he was with heom þo
Into þe cloistre of Caunterburi &punctelev; with grete noyse heo comen weue
Þe Monekus songen Euesong &punctelev; for it was welnei&yogh; eue
Some for þe grete noyse &punctelev; fullen adoun for fere
And some bigonne to fleon aboute &punctelev; ase men þat witlese were
Seint thomas nam ane Croyz &punctelev; ake oþure armes non
And þarewith wel baldeliche &punctelev; he eode a&yogh;ein is fon
Þis Monekus ornen[MS. ornem] to him some &punctelev; "sire, merci," heo seiden
"For godes loue abid &yogh;ut here &punctelev; ore louerd þe mai &yogh;uyt rede
Soffre þat we helpen þe &punctelev; oþur þat we with þe dei&yogh;e."
Some wolden makien þe doren &punctelev; þo heo þat folk isei&yogh;e
"bileuez," quath þe holie Man &punctelev; "&yogh;e ne doth nou&yogh;t as þe wise
Singuth forth ower auesong &punctelev; and doth ore louerd is seruise
Man ne schal of holi churche &punctelev; castel maken non
latez foles ane stounde awede &punctelev; and in heore folie gon!"
Þe kni&yogh;tes comen reken In &punctelev; heore folie forto do
And seiden, "&yogh;ware is nouþe þis traitour &punctelev; and þis false bischop also?"
[thomas.]¶ Seint thomas bar þe Croiz on honde &punctelev; and answerede is fon
"Ich am here, godus preost &punctelev; ake traitour nam ich non
Sechez him þat wole ov fleo &punctelev; oþur þat drede ovwer þretninge
Non rediore ne beoth ower swerdes &punctelev; me to deþe bringue
Þat min heorte prestore nis &punctelev; þene deþ forto take
For þe ri&yogh;tes of holi churche &punctelev; Inelle nou&yogh;t det forsake."
Þare wende forth on of heom &punctelev; and is huyre of him drou&yogh;
And is mantel anon afterward &punctelev; with gret uilte inou&yogh;
Sire Reynaud le fiz ours &punctelev; pursiwede him anon
¶ "Sire Reynaud," quat seint thomas þo &punctelev; "hov schal þis nouþe gon
Ofte ich habbe þe guod ido &punctelev; and manie oþure mo."
"Þov schalt sone," quath þis oþur &punctelev; "iwite hou it go
Traitour, þou art ded anon &punctelev; non oþur nelle ich do."
"Forsoþe," quath þis holi man &punctelev; "wel prest ich am þerto
For þe ri&yogh;tes of holi churche &punctelev; dei&yogh;e ichulle wel fawe
&YOGH;if heo mi&yogh;te þereafterward &punctelev; in pais beo and in lawe
Ak ich ov bidde &yogh;if &yogh;e sechez me &punctelev; in ovre louerdes name
Þat &yogh;e ne comen nei&yogh; non oþur man &punctelev; harm ne do ne schame
For non oþur gulti nis &punctelev; of þat &yogh;e witez me
heo buth alle gultlese bote ich one &punctelev; þarof sikere &yogh;e beo
And also ase heo gultlese beoth &punctelev; harmles latez heom wende."
Þe guode man sat adoun akneo &punctelev; þo he sai al þe ende
Forto afonge þene stronge deth &punctelev; is heued he buyde adoun
And softe, ase some iherden &punctelev; he seide þis oresoun
[Oratio thome.]¶ "Ore louerd and seinte Marie &punctelev; and seint Denis also
And alle þe avouwes of þis churche &punctelev; In &yogh;was ore ich am ido
Ich bitake mine soule here &punctelev; and holi churche ri&yogh;te."
&YOGH;eot he bad for holi churche &punctelev; þo he nadde non oþur mi&yogh;te
Sire Reynaud le fiz ovrs &punctelev; mest schrewe of echon
Forto smite þis holi man &punctelev; is swerd he drou&yogh; anon
¶ Ake Edward grim, þat was is clerk &punctelev; in g[ra]untebrugge ibore
his louerd to helpe &yogh;if he mi&yogh;te &punctelev; his Arm he pulte bifore
he woundede is Arm swyþe sore &punctelev; þat blod orn faste adoun
W[i]th þulke dunte he smot also &punctelev; seint thomas ope þe croun
Þat blod orn bi[MS. bi corr. to to] is face adoun &punctelev; In is ri&yogh;t half of þe wounde
Lovde gradde þis luþere kni&yogh;t &punctelev; "smitez alle to grounde!"
Edward grim and[MS. and and] alle is men &punctelev; þat þo aboute him were
Atornen aboute ech in is side &punctelev; ope þe weuedes for fere
Ase it bi ore louerd ferde &punctelev; þo þe giwes him nome
his desciples flovwen anon &punctelev; men nusten &yogh;ware heo bicome
For in þe godspel it is iwriten &punctelev; þat ore louerd himself seide
"&YOGH;wane a man smit þene schepherde &punctelev; þe schep wollez tosprede"
And ore louered bad for is desciples &punctelev; þat men ne scholden hem[MS. him] non harm do
Þaron þou&yogh;te seint thomas &punctelev; he bad for is men also
An oþur kni&yogh;t smot seint thomas &punctelev; in þulke sulue wounde
And made him bouwie is face adoun &punctelev; and loke toward þe grounde
Þe þridde in þulke sulue stude &punctelev; þareafter him smot anon
And makede him loute adoun &punctelev; is face to þe ston
In þulke stude þe feorþe smot &punctelev; þare þe oþere hadden er ido
Þat þe point of is swerd brak &punctelev; In þe Marbre ato.
¶ &YOGH;eot þat ilke point at Caunterburi &punctelev; þe Monekus doth wite
For honour of þe holi man &punctelev; þat þarewith was ismite.
With þulke stroke he smot al of &punctelev; þe scholle and þe croune
Þat þut brain ful on þe pauement &punctelev; al abrod þare doune
þat &yogh;wite brayn[MS. braym] was imeind &punctelev; with þe rede blod þere
Þat colur was wel fair to seo &punctelev; þei ich[al. hit] reulich were
Al round it orn aboute is heued &punctelev; ase it were a dyademe
And alround þareabouten it lay &punctelev; &yogh;wareof men token grete &yogh;eme
For &yogh;wane men peyntiez an Anletnesse[al. halewe] &punctelev; &yogh;e ne seoth it nou&yogh;t bileued
Þat þere nis depeint a Roundel &punctelev; alaboute þe heued
Þat rondel men cleopiez þe diademe. &punctelev; for manie iseien þat cas,[al. as me se&yogh; þer a fair cas]
bi þe diademe of is brayne &punctelev; þat he holi was
Þo þis holi man imartret was &punctelev; þis kni&yogh;tes graden echon
"Þis traitour is to deþe ibrou&yogh;t &punctelev; wende we henne anon
Siwieth us &yogh;e kingus men alle &punctelev; and alle þat with him beoth
Of þis traytur &yogh;e beoth awreke &punctelev; ase &yogh;e nouþe iseoth
he þou&yogh;te beo herre þane þe king &punctelev; and binimen him is croune
And bringe to nou&yogh;t al engelond &punctelev; ake nouþe he lijth þare doune."
Ase þe giwes bi ore louerd seiden &punctelev; þo heo wolden him to deþe do
Þat he made him kin[g] and non nas &punctelev; and godes sone also
Þo þis luþere kni&yogh;tes weren &punctelev; fram þis holi man igon
Robert de brok him biþou&yogh;te &punctelev; and turnede him a&yogh;en anon
And þoru&yogh; þe scolle smot is swerd &punctelev; deope withInne is heued
Þo þe scolle al amti was &punctelev; and no brayn Inne bileued
Ase þe giwes leten smite ore louerd &punctelev; to þe heorte grounde
After þe deþe with a spere &punctelev; and maden þe fifte wounde
¶ Þis luþere men alle in one stude &punctelev; smiten seint thomas
In þe scolle ri&yogh;t euene abrod &punctelev; þare is croune was
he nas nou&yogh;t þe man þat he wolde &punctelev; is heued enes withdrawe
Ne fondi forto fleo heore strokes &punctelev; ne enes aweiward wawe
Ne nou&yogh;t enes groni ne makien cri &punctelev; bote mildeliche and softe
Euere he heold is heued forth &punctelev; alþei heo smiten him ofte.
Þis luþere kni&yogh;tes wenden anon &punctelev; to is tresorie
breken is doren and is coffres &punctelev; and duden gret robberie
heo nomen is cloþes and is hors &punctelev; and is tresor also
Chartres and oþur priue writes &punctelev; þat in is coffres weren ido
heo it bitoken sire Randolf de brok &punctelev; þat he þarewith wende
to þe kinge into Noremandie &punctelev; and segge þat heo him sende
And þat he dude þarewith &yogh;wat he wolde &punctelev; and &yogh;if þare ani were
A&yogh;en is wille oþur is fraunchise &punctelev; þat he[MS. heo] sone totere
Among is tresor heo founden also &punctelev; tweie wel stronge heren
Wel filliche heo casten heom awei &punctelev; ase þei heo nou&yogh;t wurth nere
Ake naþeles heo biþou&yogh;ten heom þo &punctelev; and weren somdel in fere
And seiden bitwene heom stilleliche &punctelev; "guod man we wenez he were."
Sire willam traci tolde sethþe &punctelev; of þis guode man seint thomas
Þe bischope of Eccetre in is schrifte &punctelev; ase he of him ischriue was
Þat þo þe guode man was aslawe &punctelev; and heo ovtward were
So sore heom agros þat heo weren &punctelev; nei&yogh; witlese for fere
For heom þou&yogh;te euere ase heo eoden outward &punctelev; ne wenden heo no so bliue
Þat þe eorþe openede onder heom &punctelev; forto swolewen hem aliue.
¶ Þo þis guod man imartred was &punctelev; and þe kni&yogh;tes weren out igon
Into al þe toun of Caunterburi &punctelev; couth it was anon
Þat folc cride deolfulliche &punctelev; and to churche heo drowe
And onovreden þat holi bodi &punctelev; and custen it ofte inowe
Þe Monekus comen sone þerto &punctelev; and þis holi bodi toke
And leiden faire In one bere &punctelev; and bifore þe Autere it biwoke
Þat face was &yogh;wy&yogh;t and cler inou&yogh; &punctelev; and no blod nas þarinne
bote fram þe ri&yogh;t half of is frount &punctelev; toward þe left chinne
A smal rewe þere was of blode &punctelev; þat ouer is nose drou&yogh;
More blod þar nas in al is face &punctelev; ase folk isai&yogh; inou&yogh;
Þe woundene bledden al þe ni&yogh;t &punctelev; and men henten þareof, iwis
And In þe churche of Caunterburi &punctelev; of þulke blode &yogh;eot is
Ake he nas neuere of þe worse hewe &punctelev; for al þat he bledde þere
bote in guode heowe and cler inov &punctelev; ri&yogh;t ase he liues were
And somdel ley&yogh;inde with þe mouþe— &punctelev; he lai ase þei he slepe
Muche folk was aboute him &punctelev; þat blod forto kepe
And forto gaderi of þe blode &punctelev; þat isched was on þe grounde
And of þat eorþe þat was bibled &punctelev; and glade weren &yogh;wan heo it founden
¶ For þat nolde heom noman werne— &punctelev; þicke awei men it drou&yogh;
And hoso mi&yogh;te enes þat bodi cusse &punctelev; he was glad inou&yogh;
Amorewe þe luþere kni&yogh;tes &punctelev; Armeden heom eftsone
And withoute toun nome heore red &punctelev; &yogh;wat heom was to done
heo biradden forto nime þat holi bodi &punctelev; and with wilde hors todrawe
And sethþe hangen it on a waritreo— &punctelev; heo seiden þat it was lawe
For he nas nou&yogh;t wuyrþe to beon ibured &punctelev; In churche ne In churche|&yogh;erd
Þe Monekus þou&yogh;ten þis swiþe wel &punctelev; and weren ful sore aferd
heo bureden þat holi bodi &punctelev; hasteliche þerebiside
With luyte solempnete inov&yogh; &punctelev; for heo ne dorsten no leng abide
Þis holi bodi was ibured &punctelev; In þe munstre of ihesu crist
bifore seint Austines weuede &punctelev; and seint Iohanes þe baptist
heo ne dorsten nou&yogh;t so longue &punctelev; forto þat bodi iwasche were
Al ongreiþet to leggen it In &punctelev; [heo] hei&yogh;eden bliue for fere
Ase heo strepten of is cloþes &punctelev; al aboue heo founde
Clerkene cloþes ase him to bifeol &punctelev; and oþere bi þe grounde
Monekene Abite withInne &punctelev; ase heo founden þere
boþe Covele and stamin &punctelev; he founden next is here
So þat he was Monek withInne &punctelev; and seculer withoute
Nuste no man is priueite &punctelev; of þa[t] him was aboute
And next is flesche þe here was &punctelev; with knottes mani on
Þat deope in is flesche seten &punctelev; some ri&yogh;t to þe bon
Þarof he hadde schurte and brech &punctelev; luytel aise he mi&yogh;te ifele
So þat he was þareinne ibounde &punctelev; fram þe scholdre to þe hele
With luytel aise he mi&yogh;te sitte &punctelev; and ful onaisiliche ride
And onaisiliche ligge also &punctelev; opon eþur side.[This v. on the margin.]
Ful of wormes was is flesch &punctelev; to al oþur wo
In none creature, ich onderstonde &punctelev; neuere ne weren iseie mo
For in euereche stude of is flesche &punctelev; so þicke heo weren isete
Þat þe grete ne mi&yogh;ten for þe smale &punctelev; comen to heore mete
Faste heo schouen and cropen also &punctelev; ase ametene[formice overwr.] al aboute
Ake þe smale cleoueden faste to &punctelev; þe grete bilefden withoute
¶ he deide endleue houndret &yogh;er &punctelev; and seuenti and on
After þat ore swete louerd &punctelev; of is moder nam flesch and bon
Of þreo and fifti &yogh;eres elde &punctelev; himsulf he was þo
Mani a fair dai he hadde ileoued &punctelev; in care and in wo.
Þe king was in normandie &punctelev; and herof nuste nou&yogh;t
he made deol and sorewe inou&yogh; &punctelev; þo þe tiþinge him was ibrou&yogh;t
In þe Castel of Argenteyn &punctelev; he soiornede þo
Withoute þe &yogh;ates ne cam he nou&yogh;t &punctelev; fourti dai&yogh;es ne mo
Ake euere he heold him in priuete &punctelev; In wepinge and oþur wo
For none neode þat Man mi&yogh;te habbe &punctelev; withoute he nolde go
Ne rou&yogh;te he noþing of þe world &punctelev; wel luyte he eat also
Þe sorewe and þe deol þat he made &punctelev; ne mi&yogh;te neuere beo ido
he sende anon to Caunterburi &punctelev; for þis deolful dede
And bad þe Monekus pitousliche &punctelev; þat heo for him bede
And sende heom þat it nas &punctelev; noþing bi is rede
Ake þat þe kni&yogh;tes wenden forth &punctelev; and noþing him fore ne seide
And þat he sende after heom &punctelev; forto comen a&yogh;e
¶ And are þe messeger were to heom icome &punctelev; huy weren fer in þe se
to þe pope also god &punctelev; þe king sende sone
And bad is conseil pitousliche &punctelev; &yogh;wat him were to done
he bad him for þe loue of god &punctelev; In swyche anguise him rede
Þat he were ischriue and asoilled &punctelev; of so luþer a dede
Þe pope hadde ful gret pite &punctelev; þat he swuch word him sende
¶ And gret Ioye for he hadde wille &punctelev; is lif forto amende
twei cardinales he sende him &punctelev; wise men boþe to
to schriuen him of þulke sunne &punctelev; and asoilli him also
And þe bischopus forto asoilli also &punctelev; þat weren in mansinge
Welle, þat þe Cardinales &punctelev; welcome weren þe kinge
Þe king bad heom deolfulliche &punctelev; to schriuen him of þe dede
And bihet heom studefastliche &punctelev; to stonden alto heore rede
he swor on þe halidom &punctelev; þat þoru&yogh; him nas it nou&yogh;t
Ne bi is wille, ne bi his heste &punctelev; þat he was to deþe ibrou&yogh;t
And &yogh;et he seide þat for is fader deþe &punctelev; so sori man he nas
Ne for is moderes noþemo &punctelev; Ase he for is deþe was
And he seide he wolde with guode heorte &punctelev; alle þe penaunces afonge
Þat heo wolden on him legge &punctelev; ne weren heo no so stronge
For he was enchaison of is deþe &punctelev; and of is anuy also
Þe kni&yogh;tes, forto paien him &punctelev; brou&yogh;ten him þerto
¶ Þo þe Cardinales isei&yogh;en þis &punctelev; þat he to repentaunce drou&yogh;
heo asoileden him and setten on him &punctelev; stronge penaunce inou&yogh;
In priuete ase ri&yogh;t was &punctelev; þat no man þarof nuste
And þis also þat ichulle novþe telle &punctelev; þat alle Men of wusten
his priue penaunces some weren &punctelev; fastinge forto make
[vv. 22612 om. in the other MSS.]And In fale tymes linne cloth and schurte of selk &punctelev; for is sunnes forsake
Into þe holie londe he scholde finde &punctelev; to hundret kny&yogh;tes, to fi&yogh;te
Al ane &yogh;er with þe templers &punctelev; for holi churche ri&yogh;te
¶ And þat he scholde þe status of Clarindone &punctelev; al clanliche with|drawe
Þoru &yogh;wuche statuz þis holi man &punctelev; ibrou&yogh;t was of lijfdawe
And þat he clanliche &yogh;olde a&yogh;ein &punctelev; al þat binome was
Þe bischopriche of Caunterburi &punctelev; for wrathe of seint thomas
